location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Ext 8893/47 'Caccia's tour of diplomatic, etc, posts'

physicalDescription.extent: The papers are arranged in approximate chronological order from the rear to the front of the file.

Foliation: the foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 42; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: This file contains papers relating to Assistant Permanent Under-Secretary of State for Foreign Affairs, Harold Caccia's review of diplomatic posts and positions. In particular, the papers discuss his upcoming visit to the Persian Gulf , the construction a new building for the Residency in Bahrain, and the recruitment of new staff from India. Most of the correspondence is between the Commonwealth Relations Office, Harold Caccia, and the Political Resident in the Persian Gulf.
